constructors.comment: Create the signer specified by the standard cipher/cipher.Signer.Signer-.algorithmName.

generateSignature.name: generateSignature
generateSignature.comment: Sign the passed in cipher/cipher.Signer.generateSignature.message (usually the output of a hash function)

init.name: init
init.comment:
Init the signer with its initialization cipher/cipher.Signer.init.params. The type of cipher/cipher.CipherParameters depends on the algorithm being used (see the documentation of each implementation to find out more).

Use the argument cipher/cipher.Signer.init.forSigning to tell the signer if you want to generate or verify signatures.

reset.name: reset
reset.comment: Reset the signer to its original state.

hashCode.name: hashCode
hashCode.comment:
Get a hash code for this object.

All objects have hash codes. Hash codes are guaranteed to be the same for objects that are equal when compared using the equality operator ==. Other than that there are no guarantees about the hash codes. They will not be consistent between runs and there are no distribution guarantees.

If a subclass overrides cipher/cipher.Signer.hashCode it should override the equality operator as well to maintain consistency.

runtimeType.name: runtimeType
runtimeType.comment: A representation of the runtime type of the object.

==.comment:
The equality operator.

The default behavior for all dart-core.Objects is to return true if and only if this and cipher/cipher.Signer.==.other are the same object.

Override this method to specify a different equality relation on a class. The overriding method must still be an equivalence relation. That is, it must be:

  • Total: It must return a boolean for all arguments. It should never throw or return null.

  • Reflexive: For all objects o, o == o must be true.

  • Symmetric: For all objects o1 and o2, o1 == o2 and o2 == o1 must either both be true, or both be false.

  • Transitive: For all objects o1, o2, and o3, if o1 == o2 and o2 == o3 are true, then o1 == o3 must be true.

The method should also be consistent over time, so equality of two objects should not change over time, or at least only change if one of the objects was modified.

If a subclass overrides the equality operator it should override the cipher/cipher.Signer.hashCode method as well to maintain consistency.

noSuchMethod.name: noSuchMethod
noSuchMethod.comment:
cipher/cipher.Signer.noSuchMethod is invoked when users invoke a non-existent method on an object. The name of the method and the arguments of the invocation are passed to cipher/cipher.Signer.noSuchMethod in an dart-core.Invocation. If cipher/cipher.Signer.noSuchMethod returns a value, that value becomes the result of the original invocation.

The default behavior of cipher/cipher.Signer.noSuchMethod is to throw a dart-core.NoSuchMethodError.

toString.name: toString
toString.comment: Returns a string representation of this object.
